Reviews.Title: “For the price. You can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: Jiminthesuninlux
Reviews.Content: I booked that day before online and got a 50% discount on the walk in price! For 50 quid it felt like a good deal. The place is nothing special, but totally fine and does the job for short term stays near kings cross.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: iddsy
Reviews.Content: booked a twin room for me and a friend as was in town for a gig.was very happy with the room,as there was a double and a single bed.very clean and spacious.shower door wouldnt close properly.which made for an interesting shower,but that was the only gripe i had.for the price we paid was very happy,some people just moan about anything!! what do they expect for the price???

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Peter D
Reviews.Content: Dont stay here. This hotel is one of the worse I have ever stayed in London. It's a total rip off, the noise is awful, it smells and there are unidentiifed stains on the carpets and walls. Do yourself a favour and pay the little extra for something better.

Reviews.Title: “Unsecured Staycation”
Reviews.Author: osusmermaid05
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were celebrating his birthday and our 2 year anniversary. We both live in London but we're not from London so we thought staying in the heart of the city away from our flats would be nice. It was a fantastic location, particularly as Old Street/Angel is one of our favourite places to go out at night. We also discovered the London Canal Museum which is now one of our favourite places as you can walk along the Canal to Camden Town. The hotel itself was a decent value for the money, however the hotel staff were next to useless. They operate on a system where you leave your room key at the front door. Maybe I'm a bit paranoid, but they don't do any type of check to make sure it's actually your room key you're taking when you come back. I felt like anyone could come in say my room number and get into our room. It seems like a fairly simple precaution for them to take a photo or ask for ID when you ask for the room key and for this reason I wouldn't recommend again.

Reviews.Title: “Low backpacker standard - go elswhere”
Reviews.Author: farrowp
Reviews.Content: I booked this place on price only as I was staying in town for a function. reception is ok minimum interest by staff who I guess are paid a low rate. the general decor of this place is very tired and in need of a major overhaul. The room I got was tiny but good enough to sleep after a late night. shower was so small when I turned round I switched it off. cleanliness was a low standard. this really is a budget place I paid Â£42 for the night on a so called special deal. My opinion is - if you dont need to stay here then dont. simple as that.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again, hotel website misleading and pictures seemed to be of another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: destiny016
Reviews.Content: The room was small dirty, looked like it had not been decorated for 15 years. The window had been painted in the open position and therefore left a 12inch gap open and fixed. The only protection was a secondary double glazed unit which was ineffficent. The heating did not work at all, the fridge stank and was loud, the kettle did not boil prooperly and the lid had broken off. The bathroom - shower base had been mended with expanding foam, it was dirty, the toilet did not flush unless the lid of the cistern was removed and the ball cock adjusted. The shower was ineffective and thankfully we wlft before breakfast. The staff however were pleasant and helpful. I would recommend anybody to give this hotel a wide berth and look for somewhere else. Extemely poor

Reviews.Title: “Arriva”
Reviews.Author: a_m_holmes
Reviews.Content: Cheap but shabby. Ask for a quiet room at the back or you will stay awake all night. Breakfast poor but bathroom good and clean room, if tiny. Spend a few pounds more for a room only deal elsewhere and eat at a cheap cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: Effie811
Reviews.Content: Tiny cramped room which was dirty. Very rude unwelcoming people all around the hotel, breakfast a sham 2 limp pieces of toast. Tip dont try to spend less on a good nights sleep the noise in and around this hotel is awful!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Subramaniam T
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most horrible hotels i have ever stayed in. When our travel agent booked this hotel he booked it on an avg of 105 GBP per night for 9 days. When we checked in the hotel we faced the following issues. Apart from being a dirty place. 1. Room heaters are not working 2. Water quality in bathroom is bad, We saw black particles comming out of the tap. 3. Malfunctioning lights 4. No locker facility 5. Room cannot be fully locked from inside. 6. Very basic breakfast- does only include toasted bread, juice we complained to the manager and wanted to cancel the hotel but they still charged us 2 night of stay as per cancellation policy. But one thing i must appreciate is the courtsey of the staff who were very good and they did shift us to a better room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Colin055
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the hotel in the past and been unimpressed. However on my most recent vieit it was obvious that the first floor room had recently been refurbished and was tastefully decorated. Couldn't fault it for the price and location near the mainline stations. Bathroom adequately appointed. Checking in and out went smoothly, no problem with noise, and the staff were pleasant enough. The view wasn't anything to write home about but it was dark most of the time I was there anyway. Breakfast room is too small and a bit basic but the food was good enough. Good value for the odd night.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dirty, dirty”
Reviews.Author: Yorkguy2
Reviews.Content: Although location is convenient from King's cross, actual hotel is a rat hole. Filth is a key moto in the owner's service policy and there's abundance of it: filthy carpets (didn't dare walk barefoot), hairs from previous clients, suspicious spots on the bed sheets, and more. Oh - avoid the rooms in the basement, where you stay next to the dirty laundry room and the kitchen (same price as rest of hotel...).

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay, worth it all!”
Reviews.Author: Jennjenn7488
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was a bit apprehensive about our stay however on arrival was greeted by a friendly receptionist and given directions to the room which was clean and tidy with no signs of damp or mice as previous reviews had said! We went to venture out and when we asked for directions the receptionist printed out a map for us and showed us the way to go! The reception area is manned through out the night so doesn't matter what time you return if you go out! The hotel is a 2* hotel it is also very cheap and so I think when booking you need to bare this in mind! I personally would stay again if visiting London!

Reviews.Title: “A bargain during off-peak season”
Reviews.Author: zilojian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near to King's Cross station. The room is clean and of a reasonable size. However, the bathroom [shower area] is too small. We could hardly turn around to get the shower foam while bathing. It is over-priced during peak season but could be a bargain during off-peak in comparison to other B&Bs around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: jana_kocova
Reviews.Content: The Arriva hotel was in perfect location just 5min.from King's Cross station. Room I booked was single and they gave me a double for the same price. I must say my room was very clean and newly refurbished The staff were helpful and friendly. The breakfast was good althought there was only a choice of corn flakes or choco rice,toasted bread. Jana

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: mafnaa
Reviews.Content: Been there in July '11, stayed for three nights. Staff is helpful, room is clean and tidy. Guy on the reception helped me to find a particular shop I was searching for and printed a map. Wiew from the window is not very nice but I doubt there are hotels with better views in this area. Prices could be lower but again it was the cheapest hotel on booking.com when I was looking for accomodation. Overall rating - 9/10

Reviews.Title: “Cool staff, nice rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: julinm
Reviews.Content: Nice receptionists, all very helpful, didn't expect much help and advice from 2 star hotel reception so was nicely surprised ) Rooms seems to be recently updated, small TV but flat screen though. Location was very convenient for us, British museum and British Library in 15 mins walk, although EuroStar in aprox 8 mins walk as we travelled to Brussels after.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly, cramped - won`t be back.”
Reviews.Author: AngelaLawrence
Reviews.Content: Location was great walking distance to Kings Cross and Pancras Train Station. But that is the only good thing I can say. Found out on check-in that 3.5% will be added to bill if you use a credit card for payment. We had booked 2 rooms, as we have 2 teenage boys. Rooms were extermely small. Couldn`t open suitcase unless I placed it on the bed. Couldn`t hang up clothes as only space for suitcase was in closet area. No drawers. Very cramped- the entire hotel smelled old, musty and moldy. Breakfast was toast, jam, yougut, cold ham, cheese and cold cereal. Breakfast room very small and difficult to move around in. Guests had to take turns to eat. If I could have found other accommodations, I would not have stayed. Will not book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Connections for Eurostar”
Reviews.Author: JeffmaryPontypridd
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were met by a very helpful and polite reception. Our room was very spacious and Clean. ( Number 40). Plenty of tea and coffee. Only draw back was that the included breakfast is only available from 7-30am. Not far away there is a pub that provides very adequate meals.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know what the fuss is about - my stay was perfectly fine”
Reviews.Author: wastedspace
Reviews.Content: After reading a good number of the reviews only AFTER I had booked it, I feared the worse. So I arrived at the hotel with my expectations very low. I think some of the reviews haven't really factored in that it has a 2-star rating... So my overall rating was based on this. I have stayed in 4 & 5 star hotels in the past, and you just have to adjust your expectations accordingly. If some reviewers received a poor service though, this is fair enough. I was down on business for 3 nights, so really I was just needing a bed & place to wash. My double room was on the first floor at the back of the hotel. So although the window was single-glazed, I wasn't disturbed by noise at night (and I'm a light sleeper!). Saying that I was only staying mid-week. The room, although not large was fine. The decor was fairly modern, and it had a tv, tea/coffee making facilities, shampoo, soap, hairdryer, hot water(!) etc. Not bad I thought for 2 stars! I didn't actually use the breakfast room at all, as I just ate at the office. Nor did I pay for the wifi. So I can't comment/rate on this. You're probably wondering why I didn't give it five stars. There were a couple of small reasons for this. The TV signal kept going fuzzy every 10 mins or so then back to normal. But then I wasn't really there to watch TV, so didn't complain. Also after making myself a cup of tea in the room on the first morning, I realised there was no spoon/stirrer to stir my tea. So I improvised & then mentioned it to reception as I left that morning, and to please give me a spoon tomorrow. But they didn't seem to remember. I didn't bother making a big deal of it for the rest of my stay. Just a bit annoying. Overall though my stay was fine & uneventful. And so close to my London office, that I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Like a doss house; only worse!”
Reviews.Author: Bettsy35
Reviews.Content: Arrived, couldn't check in, when the right staff member arrived the booking was wrong and there was no desire to correct it. Finally looked at the room, frankly I wouldn't let my dog stay in it so promptly walked out and stayed in the local Travel Lodge which was excellent. If you wish to torture yourself, stay at the Arriva

Reviews.Title: “We won't be staying here again.”
Reviews.Author: ajbass
Reviews.Content: Booked for a Saturday night as we couldn't get a room anywhere else locally at the same price. We had to leave at around 7.00 so weren't able to take the breakfast and we weren't offered anything as a substitute, not even a roll and butter. The room was the oddest we've ever stayed in. The bedhead was against a radiator which, in turn, was against one of the original glazed front doors of the terrace. We were sleeping in the old hall way. Traffic noise at night was loud. The room was fairly clean but the furnishings were very sad and the duvet cover was faded and had cigarette burns. The room cost us Â£50 per head for the night. I'd rather have slept on a bench at St Pancras and saved the hundred pounds. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Make no mistake this is very much a 'budget' hotel”
Reviews.Author: geoffwilson1008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Arriva Hotel in June for a one night business trip to London. The hotel was booked the day prior to arrival and charged at Â£80 per night with a very good overall description on booking.com My expectations were not that high but I was very dissapointed in the room which was in the basement, very shabby and sparesley furnished though the bedding and towels looked clean. The bed was the worst I have experienced in many years of business travel with the springs nearly coming out of the mattress. The TV was so high up on the wall that it was barely visible and the picture kept going off. The shower room was clean but the water from the shower was barely a trickle. I didn't take breakfast as I had to leave early for a meeting before 7.30 am when continental breakfast was available. Overall a poor expereince, not to be recommended and certainly not good value for Â£80 per night albeit in London.

Reviews.Title: “Fine For overnight Stays”
Reviews.Author: meadowman
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight prior to catching eurostar, with some misgivings given the reasonable cost (Â£45). i have to say that we were pleasantly suprised. Staff were friendly our room was clean and there had obviously some fairly recent redecoration. the breakfast was basic but adequate. Ok for an overnight stop perhaps not for an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay if last resort”
Reviews.Author: LJM85
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of bad reviews about this place but as it was the only hotel not fully booked in my price range I thought I'd stay anyway and maybe the people reviewing were just being fussy....they weren't. We got to the hotel early so we left our bags in the "luggage room". More like a room full of boxes and other rubbish they can't find places for. We didn't have to check them in and were just told to put them in the room along with everyone elses. The room was dirty. The bathroom had grime around the edges of the fixtures, there was damp on the walls, stains on the bedding and wallpaper coming away. When you flushed the toilet it would let out a high pitched squealing noise for a few minutes. Not good if you need to go when others are asleep. When we went to get breakfast there were no seats available and no staff acknowledged we were waiting so we went somewhere else. The man on the reception desk was friendly but that's the only positive thing I can say about the hotel. Don't stay unless you have nowhere else.

Reviews.Title: “In need of some TLC !!”
Reviews.Author: ianandcarole
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in the Arriva for a short leisure break and although the hotel is tired and drab, we found it clean and basic. Our room was facing the street which we thought would be fairly quiet, however, traffic continued rumbling loudly past all through the night. The room was warm and needed winows open so couldn't escape the outside noise. The bed was comfy but no real space and presume the wardrobe has no door was to save room in not having to open one!! The bathroom was adequate but if you are of a larger build space could be very tight..... In all, we were there to sleep off the days sightseeing which was thoroughly enjoyable and as we were so tired by the end of the day, it was very welcoming.The dining room is down in the basement and their idea of "continental" we found amusing as we were surrounded by a range of Europeans together with a few slices of cheese and ham then I don't think they would have any problems under the Trade Descriptions..... it does what it says on the tin.....

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless night- not good enough”
Reviews.Author: Hayleyf2890
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed one night as we had an early trip to France from st pancreas the next day, we asked the travel agent to book us in a hotel close to the station and were assured this one was the closest, we actually passed a premier inn and travel lodge that we both closer than this hotel. When arriving the man was short and we were told where our room was and also told it was a 24 hour hotel. On arrival into our room we found our window looked onto the road and had no lock what so ever so anyone could come it (it was a large bay window and was open on arrival. Also our room was positioned next door to a staff bathroom so we had the reception talking all night and the handryers goin off as well had 2 hours sleep only. It was horrific. Go to travel lodge

Reviews.Title: “Reliably, consistently, average - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkie082
Reviews.Content: I nearly always head to Kings Cross whenever i am in London, as its fairly central and has a lot of cheap accommodation. Checked out a couple of different hotels online, but they were either more expensive or didnt have ensuite facilities. Ended up at the Arriva again, at 45Â£ for a single ensuite with Continental Breakfast. Stayed here before and it doesnt change much, but its always good value and clean. On this occassion i had no hot water in the moring, and i overheard someone at breakfast saying they had not had it for 4 days. The location is less than 10 mins walk from Kings Cross Station, and as it is so consistent i would probably go back again. Note i booked with Booking.com, but the hotels tried to charge me an extra 3.5 % on top becuase i was paying by credit card. I did not accept this becuase it was not mentioned on www.booking.com

Reviews.Title: “Great value and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Phian
Reviews.Content: I used various comparison sites and found this Hotel was approx. 50% cheaper than most competitors by the time I made the booking. We only needed a room for the night before catching Eurostar from St Pancras so were prepared for some of the negative points in previous reviews but it was actually very good. The man on reception was very welcoming and the room, although small, was clean and more than adequate for our needs. The breakfast was fine and the staff friendly. The Hotel was only a short walk to the Station. Next time we use Eurostar, Arriva will be our first choice Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a night or two before the trips from St. Pancras/Kings X or Euston”
Reviews.Author: sergeika30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Arriva Hotel for two nights in January 2011. We needed a place to stay within walking distance from Euston and Kings X Stations as on the first and second days we had trains at about 5.30 am and 7 am. We paid for a twin room 69 pounds (in total for two persons). By the way, if you don't pay in cash, an extra 3,5% of the amount will be charged. We had a room on the first floor. Pros: - Perfect location just 10 min walk from St. Pancras/Kings X Stations and 20 min walk from Euston Station. Cons: - Noise - you hear absolutely everything from the neighbor rooms and from the street. - Old furniture and old beds. My opinion - if you need just a place to stay before your train from the mentioned three stations and are not going to stay in the hotel for a long time, it's okay. Otherwise, you have more interesting choices in the area!!

Reviews.Title: “Go to Travelodge instead!”
Reviews.Author: siobhan79
Reviews.Content: Let me list the notable things about our room: 1. Steps down into the room - we didn't know about this, there was no warning and the receptionist said nothing, so my friend promptly fell down them onto the floor, narrowly missing the wardrobe which was straight ahead. Fortunately she didn't injure herself. 2. Kettle was too small to fit into the sink to fill, had to fill with cups provided. 3. Smoke alarm was fixed, but covered in polythene like it was brand new. 4. Drafty door in the corner disguised as a window with bed pushed up against it, the head board leaning free against the door. 5. Hotel on main road, our room was on that side. Traffic picked up around 5am and was quite niosy. 6.Breakfast room smells strange, no windows and staff were not talkative, food was basic cornflakes, toast, plastic ham and cheese, no fry ups or pastries. Although the location in excellent and the reception was gleaming, the rooms...well...I think it depends which room you get! First off most - if not all the rooms are below street level. My friend and I checked in, and our room was at the very back of the hotel. As soon as my friend unlocked the door, she took a step into the room and promptly fell down three steps which the receptionist had not warned us about, NOR was there a warning on the door about steps down into the room. She could have hit her head quite badly on the wardrobe or fell badly onto her bags, but fortunately she didn't. I turned the light on and saw the room. Yes, it was a large room (we booked a twin), and yes it was clean. The wardrobe could have been put against the disguised door in the corner, eliminating the draft. Breakfast was basic with just cornflakes or bran flakes, orange or apple juice, toast and the continental option comprised of plastic ham and cheese. No fry ups or pastries here! The room had a strange smell, the staff untalkative, and no windows either. Would not stay here or recommend - go to travelodge instead!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: ColmHalpin
Reviews.Content: The term "student accommodation" would be unfair to use here as I would be insulting Student Accommodation! I will never stay in this run-down HOLE again and I would strongly advise all other travellers to STAY AWAY. Extremely expensive for dire conditions!

Reviews.Title: “Good value but no hot water at "peak" times...”
Reviews.Author: LostDocuments
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights at the beginning of December. Location was excellent, fifteen minute walk from Euston with lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Room was small, but comfortable. A little noisy as our room faced the front of the hotel. Breakfast was limited but pleasant and overall, the hotel is good value for money. I found staff friendly but there is a major issue with the hot water running out at certain times, mostly in the morning when most are getting up for breakfast. If you shower at night or after 11am, there wasn't much of a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but this is no frills accomodation”
Reviews.Author: katyk10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arriva for one night as it was very convenient for St Pancras Station, only a 15 minute walk away. The room was pretty cramped with 2 beds, my sister and I had to squeeze around each other as there was not much room and a tiny shower room,seemed clean but a bit dated. There was a TV but it was postitioned so high up on the wall you had to crane your neck to watch it ! It cost Â£65 for one night, for the size it really wasn't worth the money at all. If you need somewhere close to the station and just rest your head this would suffice, but if you want a room you are spending time in to relax etc, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money fab location”
Reviews.Author: Viki123
Reviews.Content: When I read the reviews on this hotel we were dreading going, but we were pleasantly surprised. On our arrival at 11.20am we were greeted by a very friendly face who told us we could keep our luggage until we checked in at 2.00pm. I cannot comment on the dining room and the food as we did'nt use it but the rooms were very clean and tidy, they were cleaned daily. We also had a problem with our sink and because they couldnt fix it they changed our room immediately. The location of the hotel was great walking distance to all major routes. Really enjoyed our stay will book for our trip next time. Thanks guys

Reviews.Title: “absolute value for money”
Reviews.Author: suziet-10
Reviews.Content: room was cleaned daily,really good helpful staff no problems at all 100% value for money

Reviews.Title: “Be realistic people!!”
Reviews.Author: Naomi57
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night stay at the Arriva hotel, and from reading the reviews on here I was dreading going, then we arrived at Euston train station to be told it was quicker to walk than get on the tube, it took 10 mins at most. upon arrival I was suprised the reception was very clean we were greated with a smile and we were given our room, which in my opinion was the worst situated room in the whole building it was on the ground floor next to the toilet, lift, and breakfast room ,number 33. However, even with all these things it didnt bother us, the room was clean tidy the fridge and tv worked, the bed only had two pillows on it so I asked for some more at reception and they brought them to me about 10mins later, the bed wasn't very comfy that is probably my only complaint. The shower room was like new although due to the amount of rooms the hot water had ran out by 9:30. I cant comment on the breakfast room as I myself never went but my partner did he loves his toast so he was happy. As for people not feeling safe on the ground floor, there is a big drop from the window so someone would have to be like spider man if they wanted to get in your room, There is a nice pub at the top of the road and loads of things going on round and about. King cross station is 5mins away so a great bonus. All in all we paid Â£26.50 each a night which is very cheap for the location I feel great value for money. If people expect the ritz then they should be prepeared to pay ritz prices.

Reviews.Title: “We wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: ddmfgo
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because of its proximity to the train station. We had a reservation but were given a room on the basement floor, which meant that we did not feel we could leave our window open because someone could enter the room from outside the hotel. The room was very small and rather uncomfortable. When we attempted to place an outside call, the desk clerk informed us that not outside calls could be placed from the hotel. The hotel was able to store our luggage following check-out, but the room in which luggage was stored did not appear very secure. We definitely would not stay here again or recommend this hotel to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “What is all the fuss about?”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_Stones
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Hotel Arriva and found it clean, functional, easy to find, clean and a bargain when considering London hotel prices. I paid Â£75 for one night with B&B for me and my wife. I looked at the many reviews and didn't see why there was so much negativity. To me it was a pit stop for an overnight sleep plus a rest in the late afternoon after a day sightseeing before going out for a meal. You are a 10 minute walk from St Pancras / Kings Cross Underfround and the Piccadily Line straight into central London. That has to be a plus. I will use it again but I not sure whether I am ready for the busy, noisy and expensive London as yet, but that's another story.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but compact - shame about breakfast and cust service”
Reviews.Author: emmColchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in Mid August. We arrive at 5pm and i wouldnt say we were welcomed exactly. We were told breakfast was until 9.30am which we thought was early for a weekend (and it turned out to be until 10am). The room and bathroom were both clean so no complaints there. The room was small as was the shower room but it was fine for one night. The TV and fridge both worked but the hairdryer gave up after a few mins. The bed was clean and comfortable but the room was hot and there was no air circulating. We did leave the window open and the 'view' was the back of some dodgy looking flats and then looking down onto the dumping area for the hotel - old beds and TV's etc. Breakfast was in a tiny room in the basement that at 9am was very busy (presumably because we had all been told it finished at 9.30!) We had to share a table with other guests which was ok but not really what i expected. A basket of toast and tea was provided and then cereal or ham and cheese or yoghurt was available. No offer of more toast either. Clean and does what it says on the tin but a bit basic is a good summary

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value and very clean”
Reviews.Author: Mazza002
Reviews.Content: We were concerned about our two night stay when we read other reviews so we were pleasantly surprised to be shown a clean, comfortable room with a modern bathroom and a window which opened. Other luxuries such as a fridge and tv which worked were an unexpected bonus. Staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was served on time which was important to us as we were catching an early Eurostar at St Pancras.

Reviews.Title: “Total Crap”
Reviews.Author: johnbarber
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my client in a double room. We have travelled to London in business purpose. I dont recomend you this hotel. Rooms were very small. We have felt like in prison. There was a lot of bad smell from bed. We were lucky we have slept. The tV didnt work properly. Bathroom is so small that you cannot move, and you dont have possibility to lock yourself inside. Breakfast was so poor. They give you two slices of bread, two slices of ham and cheese. I was starving after this breakfast. Everything was bad in this hotel. I have been in many hotels and i have never seen hotel like this. Stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst Hotels in London”
Reviews.Author: Shuffler59
Reviews.Content: Unfriendly staff, small stuffy rooms, totally agree with the other comments. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only for proximity to King's Cross Station”
Reviews.Author: talk2rajiv
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Proximity to King's Cross station; just 3-4 minutes walk 2. tidy 3. TV though small worked and so does the remote. There was even a small refrigerator in the room. 4. Not exactly value for money; but its ok. Cons: 1. Too small a room. If you have claustrophobia, please refrain from booking here. A bed is all the room can accomodate. the space around the bed is not good for even to walk around. 2. Washroom: The shower cubicle inside the washroom can only accomodate a person standing in attention; was difficult to even soap up. 3. Staff: They badly need a lesson or two on customer service. Little warmth and very formal. Lady staff in the breakfast room (in the basement) were worst of the lot. 4. Breakfast is included in the price. But trust me, it was one of the worst I've had. They only offer continental and it was quite sick. We only ate for 1 day and ate from outside on the other days. 5. I got a room which looks to the backside of the hotel. and there were some houses and saw some suspicious looking guys standing there peering at the hotel windows. The room window is the typical English window which can be raised up and pulled down( hope you understand) and not safe at all. We went there in the peak of the summer and since there is no airconditioner in the rooms, we had a hell of a time. At night, for fear of somebody sneaking in through the window we didnt keep it open and it was difficult to sleep. Daytime or evenings we cant keep windows open bcos the guys in the houses outside can see everything in the room.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a dump”
Reviews.Author: johnToncent
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were greeted by a very sour faced individual. When we saw the rooms we had booked we were shocked at how basic they were. The furniture was shabby and of poor quality. None of us slept well because the bedding was so poor. My Duvet cover was not very clean. The view from the window was onto waste land with discarded mattresses. Because we were travelling by Eurostar from St Pancras on the 8.30am to Brussels (check in is 7.30am) We requested breakfast at 7am but were told that was not possible even though we had paid for breakfast. We paid over Â£85.00 per room which was a complete rip off bearing in mind the poor quality and shoddy service. I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Dingy, Disgusting - Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: katieedwards75
Reviews.Content: First room we were given was in the basement, the window didn't shut and you could gain access off the street via the outside stairs. Changed room which was more revolting but at least the windows which were smashed were taped up with sticky tape so passers by could just pop in! I have never stayed anywhere so revolting. Not worth 75p to stay let alone Â£75!

Reviews.Title: “One big window, with one half curtain”
Reviews.Author: lizzie22Scotland
Reviews.Content: As I checked into the hotel my first thoughts were yeah it looks ok just a bit basic. I was giving the key to my room and when I opened the door the one curtain caught my eye as soon as I walked in the room, It was actually half the size of the window. It was even worse as my room was looking out onto the busy street! Also you need to like either cheese and ham or cheap cereal if you don't no breakfast for you!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, lumpy bed, but good location.”
Reviews.Author: Winsome2
Reviews.Content: Stayed May 2010 Staff was polite and at times helpful, sheets are clean and changed daily. l don't think they wash the comforter cover though as it looked dirty. The floor had a very badly stained dark blue rug over what seemed to be cement. The bed was very lumpy. The bathroom looked clean but when the floor got wet by the toilet, the smell of urine was very noticable. On the last day of the stay a little brown bug was found crawling on the sheets. I never had any bites but it made me very nervous that I would bring home bed bugs which are extremly difficult to get rid of. Windows were not secure and the street side is very noisy. They turn off the heat during the night to save money and they charge you 3.5% extra if you pay the balance of your hotel bill with a credit card. Area is run down but did not feel frightened and the tube station is nearby. Would stay in area again but not at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and nasty, dont stay unless no where else available”
Reviews.Author: kazg17
Reviews.Content: Just got back from stay at Arriva, chose somewhere close to KingsCross after reading reviews and wanted something on a budget as booked a last minute deal. On our arrival, found bookling in to our room ok but a bit slow. Got to our room and yes, it was really basic and very small. There was a phone socket loose from the wall with all the wires showing, not a good sign, but thought not going to be spending much time in our our room. only to sleep in. When checked bed, there was only 2 pillows on a double which were really flat, when we left for our night out, asked the receptionist for 2 more pillows and he said they would be in room when we get back. On our arrival back somewhat 6 hours later, asked if pillows had been put in room, was given a vacant look and answer, after a while, receptionist then went to a basement room and brought 1 cushion back,! saidf there were 2 people in room, he then went back and brought another cusion, not pillow, and it seemed to be our fault that he had to do this!! how any hotel in this day and age does not have spare pillows in all rooms is a mystery. Did not feel very safe leaving valuables as no drawers/doors on wardrobe so everything wide open. All in all cant fault hotel for location, but as an hotel, stay here only if you are desperate, there are much nicer ones located in the vicinity as we noticed when we were walking around.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel I have ever stayed in - DON'T GO!!!”
Reviews.Author: jan29555
Reviews.Content: It's just horrible. Tiny room. Needs decorating. Filthy windows. Desperate for new carpet. Minute shower room. Kettle won't fit under tap. Plates instead of saucers to go with cups! NO bedside table!!!!!!!!! Every noise and creak heard from other rooms. Inadequate pillows. OK it's a budget hotel but all others I have stayed in were far better for less cost! Shocking breakfast - basically cornflakes and toast !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ostrich999
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight in order to get early Eurostar. The place was clean but the room we had was the smallest I've ever seen. The bathroom and shower were tiny as well - don't drop the soap or you will not be able to pick it up again. Paid Â£55 but the front desk wanted to add 3.5% credit card charge based on rack rate of Â£110 - after 5 minutes of debating this I gave up and paid. Breakfast is not served until 07:30, so we missed it. I'll be back, but only because it was cheap and clean.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: katalina_l
Reviews.Content: Hotel â€œArrivaâ€� is located in a very comfortable area. It is 7 minute away from Kingâ€™s Cross station. I had a chance to stay in a bright, cosy, small room. The bathroom , what is essential for women (especially), was very cleaned. Towels had been changed every day. The staff in the hotel are helpful and friendly. In a short period of time they satisfied me, with all my needs (as hair dryer, socket extension, taxi, maps, necessary info for tourist). It was good value for money. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: milly80
Reviews.Content: We were going to London for the weekend (2 couples) and wanted somewhere to stay that wouldn't break the bank but would be convenient and comfortable to crash after our night out. If we hadn't stayed here we probably would have stayed in a Travelodge, but this was actually cheaper, and had better reviews. We paid Â£55 per room which included continental breakfast. The Arriva Hotel is a short walk from King's Cross Station and St. Pancras International. The room was basic as you would expect for this type of rate, and quite small, but very clean. The toilet and shower room was very clean too. There was a hairdryer in the room and a wardrobe in which to hang your clothes. I would recommend this to somebody looking for a cheap place to stay whilst visiting London. Obviously it is not the Ritz but for a budget hotel it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Accommodation close to Kings Cross”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkie082
Reviews.Content: I selected this because it is walking distance from Kings Cross Railway and Tube Station. At night time you can hop onto the tube and Leicester Square is only 4 stops away. Hotel is budget accommodation with small rooms, but i did find it clean. I paid 50Â£ for a twin room with breakfast. Good value. Breakfast is basic continental, but fills a hole. I think if i was coming again i would look elsewhere, but would not be too disappointed if i ended up back here.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Chunnell train”
Reviews.Author: wanttotravelFlorida
Reviews.Content: A 2 star hotel which had a tiny room walking distance to KIngs Cross and St. Pancreus Station. The Bathroom was fairly new. and clean. No telephone. Breakfast was fine. Bed covers a little worn. Not enough light.. A internet rate that was very resonable for London. The tube is at KIngs Cross. The man at desk at night was quite helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless desperate or broke”
Reviews.Author: Glendone
Reviews.Content: It's a filthy hotel. The staff have no attitude for hospitality and appear to have no idea about London, which was a real problem for us. As a result of the Arriva Hotel's incompetence, we had a transfer booked to 'Stansted' Airport, instead of Heathrow Airport. This resulted in us missing our flight and having to pay a lot of money for new tickets and overnight accommodation to fly out the following day. The guy on reception didn't know how to book this transfer. The rooms aren't clean and the beds aren't comfortable. But if you're on a budget, or desperate, then stay here at your own risk. Just don't trust the staff to do anything for you or give you the right directions, or disinfect the toilet etc etc. You will need to do all of that yourself. And, I wouldn't eat the breakfast either as I'm sure they leave it out overnight without covering it!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel for your stay”
Reviews.Author: rameshsiram
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at a 5 to 10 min walk from Euston and King's Cross Tube stations. The Hotel is Pretty good and the front desk people arr soo good in solving all of my problems what i had in my stay of 7 days. I had been from India to this hotel and found very worthy for my money. The hotel got many attractions around as it is located in central London. All the areas like Oxford circus, piccalilly circus, soho, camedon town and lots London attractions are very near. The hotel has 24 hrs front desk where a man is continuously seated for the safety of guests. The main advantage of this hotel is it got many pubs and bars near it and more over food restaurants and grocery shops around it.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T EVER HERE STAY”
Reviews.Author: REVIEWER_52
Reviews.Content: Following a late event, I booked a room at Arriva Hotel which was already supposed to be paid for by the company credit card before my stay. My collague had emailed confirmation of payment before hand to ensure this was taken care of so I didn't have to worry. I turned up at the hotel to be greeted (or not) by a very angry and quite aggresive male receptionist who demanded my payment there and then to stay the night. Even after I explained the details and showed him confirmation, he still wanted payment and made me feeling really uncomfortable and I bit scared to be honest. I therefore paid the money but I really didn''t want to stay here that night but because it was late, I thought I would just try to sleep and leave as early as possible. I phoned the hotel in the morning to tell the other receptionist about my experience and although she was apologetic, it didn't make much of a differece. I just wanted to warn people before they book a room here, not to! Never ever had such bad customer service in my life!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Fabio R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights; the hotel is located in a good location just 3 minutes walk from King's Cross- sant Pancras tube station and this allows the hotel to recover point. Breakfast was continental, but in good quantity. Probable the cantine is a bit small for the hotel but we always found a table to seat. Check in desk was fine but the guys did't give us so many information. I love London and I think this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “the worst 'hotel' I have ever had the misfortune to stay in”
Reviews.Author: middleagedMari
Reviews.Content: To start with the (only) positives: the Arriva was somewhere handy (for King's Cross / Euston) to lay our heads overnight, was reasonably clean, and was unfazed by our late arrival (after midnight). That said, it was a Fawlty-Towers-type experience (without the humour) which I do not wish to repeat. I had emphasised in the booking that it was conditional on there being a functioning lift as stairs would be a problem to us, and asked that if there was no functioning lift the management contact us. No contact received other than a confirmation of the booking - and when we arrived we found we were in a basement room (down stairs). On enquiring about the lift we were told, offhandedly, that it was 'out of order'. No apology. When I said that this posed a problem I was told 'Oh, it's only one or two stairs - maybe three'. Actually, it was more than 20! The (male) receptionist did not offer to carry our heavy luggage down said stairs and initially stared at me when I requested help with it. Fortunately I can be assertive when required and eventually he did help. On arrival in our room we found that the advertised tea-making facilities consisted of cups and saucers but no kettle! The man on reception was unapologetic about this omission but agreed to 'see whether he could find us one', and brought it to our room half an hour later. By that time we had discovered the unbelievably uncomfortable mattresses, which appeared to have no padding between the springs and the fabric cover. Fortunately it was a hot night so we could lie on top of the duvets, which insulated us slightly from the springs. On trying to turn the light off we discovered the next problem, which was that it continued to flash on and off for the next half hour - but by this time we had realised that if we asked for anything to be done about it we would be likely to be up for a lot longer, waiting for something to be done, so we closed our eyes and tried to ignore it. In the morning, after an extremely uncomfortable night, we were foolish enough to go to breakfast: cornflakes, milk, white toast (they said they didn't have any brown, despite my having asked for that on the booking too), jam, and tea or coffee, served in a dingy, windowless basement room. When the 'waitress' said they had no brown bread to toast I asked whether anyone had read my booking request, and she unapologetically said 'no'. To be fair, the reception man did (on being asked) help us back up the stairs with our luggage. None of the staff seemed to have the slightest notion of customer care, hospitality, looking after people or even basic courtesy, and I was truly embarrassed that the many overseas visitors there would have this as part of their experience of Britain. If you had a category for 'attitude' I would rate that as 'terrible' too. Thare must be better places than this for the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mice!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller09450
Reviews.Content: The location is great only a few minutes walk from Kings Cross tube and train stations, and the front desk guy was very helpful and efficient. I checked in to a room on the street which was noisy, but it was O.K overall with a TV and a fridge. But that night I saw a mouse that did not look too scared of me as it eyed me for a few secinds then walked casually and disappeared into the bathroom! I complained and got moved to another room looking at the back, which was quieter, but I saw another mouse which was even bigger than the first. I forced myself to ignore it and slept, then checked out the next morning cancelling three more days I originally intended to stay.

Reviews.Title: “There are better”
Reviews.Author: TeacherStockholm
Reviews.Content: Tiny room, not the cleanest. Very low pressure in the shower. Had to queue up for the breakfast (the dining room was too small to fit all guests), poor breakfast anyway. We had to call the police one night due to violent action in a nearby room.

Reviews.Title: “Arriva Hotel for location and value.”
Reviews.Author: kaydoll
Reviews.Content: Positives: Great location - 5 minutes from Kings Cross St Pancras tube and railway stations. Newly installed security cameras. Overall, I found the staff responsive to my needs. The room was medium/small in size, but heaps bigger then some of the places I looked at. The was a remote controlled television, fridge, phone, hairdryer and tea/coffee facilities in the room. The bathroom looked like it had been newly renovated. Soap and shampoo provided. The room was cleaned each day with fresh towels provided. Breakfast was included in the price. This consisted of cereal, toast with jams/cold meat/cheese, juice, and tea/coffee. The breakfast room gets quite busy towards the end of service, so I suggest get down there earlier. I did not see any mice. Negatives: Although the sheets were clean, the hotel doesnÂ´t use mattress or pillow protectors. Although convenient, the bar fridge makes an intermittent droning noise that wakes you up in the middle of the night. The walls are paper-thin. Could hear doors creaking, which could use some WD40. Occasionally a kind of sewerage smell came out of the vent in the bathroom. The lock on the window appeared to have been broken previously, but still worked. Having to hand my room key in every time I went out.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible: don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: bigpackbaggybag
Reviews.Content: I didn't book this hotel, but had I read the reviews on this site first, I wouldn't have. A friend of mine gave me the bad news after I had said where I was saying, and in most cases, the reality was equal or slightly worse than the reviews. I didn't experience rodents in the room as other users seem to have, but the room was just horrible, small, poorly decorated, uncomfortable bed, an array of bizarre wall mounted phone equipment hooked together with trunking runnning up and down the walls. There was a "modern" wardrobe there, but it was a token gesture, given the rest of the room. The miniscule shower room was tiled (didn't take many floor tiles to achieve this, obviously). The shower itself was OK, but underpowered. So underwelmed, didn't try breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful place please think very hard before you book!”
Reviews.Author: pinkslippers
Reviews.Content: Badly needs overhauling and renovating, reception not very helpful. Definately do not take children with you.

Reviews.Title: “The worsed hotel experience i ever had in my life”
Reviews.Author: bell9
Reviews.Content: My first morning i woke up here a mouse ran across the floor in front of me.I've been to London before but if this was my first visit I would never go back.This hotel should not be open,I told the receptionist and he acted like it happens often, never said sorry just gave us another room across from the same one. When we walked into the first room the first thing i saw was dust on everything,it was filthy, the walls were filthy. one was no better than the other. I had to check out the breakfast much to my husbands dissapproval. What can I say. Before you stay here read the other reviews you're better off paying a little extra and having a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hot water please...and a lick of paint”
Reviews.Author: debzie
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located near to kings cross station, a good ten minute walk. The hotel is small and on a back street. Our room was available before the advised time so we checked in. The bathroom was nice except their was no hot water most of the time! Two sachets of body gel/shamppo were available. We had clean hand towels every day. There was a remote controlled tv. There were tea makiing facillities but the kettle lead wouldn't reach the socket so the kettle had to stay on the floor. We couldn't fill the kettle very well as the sink was shallow. The bedroom itself was VERY basic. The bedding was clean but marked. The furniture was old fashioned. We had 3 pillows between us. I asked for another pillow on the phone. He sounded unsure. I was given two old thin pillows in the same case? Breakfast facilities are cramped. We had to share a table. Breakfast was toast, hot drink, juice, cereal. Doors banged constantly. Bulb shoved into reading lamp above the bed head. No shade.

Reviews.Title: “Unwelcoming front office guy”
Reviews.Author: Sasha1878
Reviews.Content: I did not arrive at Arriva with great expectations but going by the website, did expect it to be a decent stay. To begin with, the front office person was extremely inhospitable (read rude). I booked a double bedroom and was taken by surprise with the size of the room. There was hardly any space left (to move around) if I put 2 suitcases flat. It really looked like a single room turned into a double one. The breakfast was bad and the TV in the room never worked. The good things about the hotel was its proximity to Kings Cross tube and to St Pancreas station and yeah, the hotel was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped and lacking”
Reviews.Author: GowerTraveller
Reviews.Content: After reading agreeable reviews about the Arriva Hotel on Tripadvisor I was looking forward to a pleasant nights stay. However, I was soon to be disappointed when I arrived and was told that my room was on the third floor and that the lift was broken. It then got worse when we went into the room and found it to be cramped due to a double bed and single bed into a room that should only have had two singles and was only set up for two people (2 cups, 1 small wardrobe, 1 chair, 2 towels etc). Due to their attempt to cram an extra bed you could not get to the small wardrobe to hang anything up, forget trying to get the chair out to use and you were literally falling over yourselves to get anywhere in the room, including the window, which did not open so no air. The bathroom was clean and serviceable but there was a lack of decent towels. The hotel also offers a TV, it is such a pity that it did not work properly (although we were not there to watch telly, it is nice to have on as you are getting ready to go out/bed/breakfast) and when reported the problem was told that nothing would be done until we left. They also offer a refrigerator in the room, but only one plug so it was a choice of a fridge which would have taken at least our dayâ€™s stay to start up or a telly that did not work! The breakfast was ok, cereal and toast was fine however the room was so small that if you got a table (not enough of them compared to guests) you could not get out and you were encouraged to leave ASAP. Overall, the hotel was clean, but very small and did not provide the services that they offer. Would I stay there again or recommend it to anyone else â€“ no.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: FyingKiwi
Reviews.Content: An unpretentious, but geat value (for London) hotel, located very conveniently close to the St Pancreas international terminal and Kings Cross Metro station. Tea and coffee masking facilities in the room a real bonus. Only negative was the ever bored looking front desk person and the very stale croissants served up each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: quof
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient, the room was small but clean and the refridgerator was an added bonus. Breakfast was not fabulous, but had all the basics including cereal, toast, juice, coffee, canned fruit, cold cuts and cheese. We were in the back, so noise was not an issue but, being on the groundfloor, we noticed that the window is accessible from the ground and was not locked until we noticed it late in our first day. Had it been warm out, it would have been foolhardy to leave the window open at night, but closing it wasn't a problem during our autumn stay. The only other concern was that, like most European hotels, keys are left at the front desk when you leave for the day. When you return, you simply give them your room number and they hand over your keys without checking in any way that it is actually your room. The keys are clearly visible and a thief could easily spot what room keys are available and claim to be in that room.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, but handy location”
Reviews.Author: Magic_Bryan
Reviews.Content: This is the very definition of budget accommodation. It's rated two star because it's cheap and basic. The place was clean and quiet for central London but does have very small rooms that seem s little run down. It is, however, VERY close to Kings Cross/St Pancras and not a million miles from Euston for that matter. If you're looking for somewhere to crash before an early Eurostar, or a very simple base you intend to spend little time in apart from sleeping and showering, this is well worth a shot. The price difference between this and a chain hotel per night is well worth considering if you're on a budget. Didn't try breakfast, as we left at the crack of dawn to try to check in for Eurostar the day after the tunnel fire. Wifi was very slow, but only a fiver. Could do worse, but don't expect a palace.

Reviews.Title: “dont be fulled by the cancelation policy”
Reviews.Author: kimpton16
Reviews.Content: i am warning others not to book this hotel, i have been charged for a room that i did not stop in and the managment are refusing to give me a refund, they are unhelpfull and agressive. I was stuck in france as the chanel tunnel had a fire and could not stop in the hotel booked, i rang the hotel the minuite i found out, two days later after checing my account i noticed they had charged me. I phoned the manager and they said they would not help me and are not interested.

Reviews.Title: “About as good as you'll get for a budget hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: greekfreak21
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is that it's about a 5 minute walk from King's Cross and St. Pancras Station - crucial if you're taking the subway/tube around London or the train to/from London. The rooms are pretty small, but decent and pretty clean. The only real beef my mother and I had with this hotel was the plumbing - the toilet did not flush very well and no matter how many times we asked someone to fix it, it never got fixed properly. The breakfast here was decent, considering it was included. Overall the place was nice for the price when compared to other hotels that were MUCH more expensive. I do not think I would go back, but it was a good hotel for tourists and not bad if all you really intend on doing is sleeping here.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: monikagrancanaria
Reviews.Content: We were 4 adults and one child staying at the hotel for 2 nights. We arrived at 11am, check-in time is at 2pm but they have a luggageroom. However, our room was ready so we could actually check-in 3 hours early, no extra charge! The rooms are quite small, all different, there is a lift, important if you have heavy suitcases. We found one of the rooms we got too small, but asked in the reception if we could change it for a bigger and it was no problem at all. The bathrooms had showers, small but clean and quite new, the rooms basic but clean, and with fridge, coffee/tea and hairdryer, all I need. There was a small tv as well, but only with a few channels, anyway we didnÂ´t go to London to watch tv. Best of all, the location! A quiet street in the citycentre. A short walkingdistance to KingÂ´s Cross. The breakfastroom is very small, you might have to wait for a table and you might have to share the table. DonÂ´t expect full English breakfast, you get coffee, tea, juice, cereals, milk, plenty of toast, jam, butter, cheese, ham, thatÂ´s it. Friendly staff with lot of work, even though in some reviews there were complaints, but we were really treated well by the staff. The only complaint we have is when we were leaving and asked the receptionist to call a taxi and to ask how much the price would for a big cab(5 persons+suitcases). He told us a price and we agreed. When the car came it wasnÂ´t a taxi but a carhire. We were a bit surprised but we found the price reasonable, however when we got to the station he wanted to charge us extra because we were 5 and he said the price that was agreed was for 4 even though we had ordered a big taxi. Of course we didnÂ´t pay more than the price that was agreed from the beginning, then he should have told us when we got in. We think the driver was a friend of the receptionist and were quite annoyed even though it really doesnÂ´t have anything to do with the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, Well located”
Reviews.Author: PortoExplorer
Reviews.Content: The Arriva Hotel is well located, in the Kings Cross area, 5 min walk from the Station, with metro, bus and train. The building is tipically in English vitorian style. Rooms seemed modernly refurbished, small thou', even smaller than expected (only 1 person fits between the bed and the wall; bathroom doesn't allow much movements with tiny washbasin). However, they were clean and unfortunately the regular for London's extremely high prices. My room had window to the back, so it was quiet. Don't expect to much from the breakfast and room.

Reviews.Title: “cheap & Tacky....”
Reviews.Author: amy007
Reviews.Content: I knew this hotel is only a 2* and i was only staying there for 1 night. the outside looked alright but when you get into the rooms you think twice, should i be staying here!!!! the fridge made sooo much noise, the tv had really bad signal and might as well been in the roof! the bathroom was clean but the shower was rubbish. threre was sticky marks on the sides in the room. over all not that clean. the man on the front desk was helpfull, it is somewhere cheap and close to kings cross station that is the only good thing i can say about this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: GladysMidlands
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband decided to stay at this hotel due to the budget price it offered. I had read reviews beforehand therefore knew roughly what to expect. We were offered a front or back room and chose the latter, thinking that is may be quieter after reading some of the reviews, regarding traffic noise. It was quiet, although the window rattled with the wind, and I had to wedge a (many times!) folded peice of paper into the gap to stop this from happening, which did the trick. The double room was adequate, the bed was comfy enough. The bathroom was clean, and the towels were changed both days. The small fridge made a loud whirring noise, annoying when your trying to sleep, so we unplugged it. Breakfast is included in the price but beware german gestapo is in charge of the breakfast room!! The first morning we were heading to a table that was free, and was politely!! ordered to sit on a table that someone else was occupying. This was obviously to save the gestapo staff the trouble of tidying the other one up. The second morning the minute the clock struck 9.30am, the breakfast room door was locked! What you see is what you get here. Would return due to budget price and locality.

Reviews.Title: “Careless treatment of reservation problems”
Reviews.Author: katastrofa
Reviews.Content: The hotel has no frills. Rooms was mostly clean (although I saw a shoe stain on the wall) and the bed comfortable. My no 1 problem with the hotel is that when I arrived, I was told that I have no reservation because my credit card was declined. However, nobody notified me about it! When I told the hotel staff that I should have been notified about it, they told me that they are "too busy to notify everyone". They didn't look *that* busy. Luckily, they had a room for me. The breakfast was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ch3rie
Reviews.Content: Small, cosy, clean hotel. For approx Â£50/night in central london it was worth it. Good location, down from kings cross. Room really hot, so wouldnt too too good when weather is warm. Breakfast was a cheap continental (no brown bread). I read the reviews about it and it was quite true. Dont expect the best, just somewhere cheap, clean and good location.

Reviews.Title: “A Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Sami-Hass
Reviews.Content: A small and cosy hotel in a very good location few minutes walk from King's Cross station. There is a couple of nice pubs around the corner and plenty of shops to buy food and drinks. Room size is quite good, and the in-room amenities include tea & coffee maker and a fridge. I was also surprised to learn that such a small hotel has a wireless Wi-Fi!!! But unfortunately it does not cover the rear part of the hotel, so make sure you check with them before you bring your laptop. The receptionists were very friendly and helpful, especially John who would go out of his way to make sure you are enjoying your stay; upon my arrival, the window in my room would not open, I called the reception and in a few minutes he was there trying to open it for me, and when he couldn't, he changed my room promptly without me needing to ask! The drawbacks were the non stopping loud bangs from doors slamming shut, and the relatively small breakfast room. Otherwise it certainly is a nice, clean place and a good value for $$.

Reviews.Title: “Budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: ScottishLaura
Reviews.Content: 2 nights in central London does not come cheap but a room at Arriva fits the budget traveller. Very good showers, clean beds, compact rooms - but then one is not going to London to be in a bedroom for long. Handy fridge. Breakfast is worth missing as the room is too small, the tables tight and the food is useful only as fuel for the action packed day ahead. Ideal location and the traffic is an issue but then - it's a city centre. Excellent having 24 hour manned reception. Would I stay again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great for budget!”
Reviews.Author: Dancastle2210
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner were visting london for the first tme on our own, we were going to see a theatre show, the hotel was great the location was easily found from kings cross station. The room itself was satisfactory however it was clean and tidy. our room faced onto the main road and we expected loud noises from trafic but there wasnt we had a peceful stay. The staff at the hotel were genrly helpful however a bit misrable. We are returing to london again in feburary and are planing to stay at the arriva hotel again. i would advise young people i.e. students or families looking for a cheap break in central london.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor”
Reviews.Author: yorkie72
Reviews.Content: I paid over Â£50 for a single room. The room overlooked a main road and the noise from the all night traffic was awful. The bed was jammed into the corner between the window and a fridge/kitchen sink!!! The fridge proceeded to hum and whir at various intervals during the night. The floor on the window side of the bed appeared not to have been swept since Margaret Thatcher was in power and the metal bed end clanged against the wall every time I moved on the bed. At least the provided Bible did the job as a temporary wedge to keep it off the wall. And also, unfortunately, as well as the traffic noise to contend with, the walls are so thin that every door bang in the hotel is heard, and if someone breaks wind five rooms down, you're going to hear it and probably smell it as well. Finally the 'luggage room' was a box room with no security/lock or anything to stop some other guest helping themself to your belongings. Avoid like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “decent value for short stay”
Reviews.Author: landslug
Reviews.Content: I needed a cheap place to stay 3 nights while attending a weekend of concerts (the hotel was listed on the website of one of the venues). My single room was quite small, but I didnt plan to spend much time there anyway. The room was clean and decently maintained. The pillow was pretty lumpy, but I've had that at much more expensive places too. The room had a working fridge, sink, & water boiler, and there was a fresh supply of instant coffee & tea delivered every day. I missed the breakfast, as it was only served until 9am. I stocked the fridge instead with pastries & fruit from a nearby grocery store. The TV was small, but worked (no cable). I had no problem with running hot water, and the desk clerk even got me into my room an hour early, due to my plane arriving ahead of schedule. The location is very convenient, being that all the tube lines pass into King's Cross station. I would stay here again, under similar circumstance. I wouldnt use a room this small for a long stay - but that goes for all hotels, not just this one.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy feeling in the basement!!”
Reviews.Author: baglady83
Reviews.Content: I stayed here whilst in London for one night as a lone female traveller. It was cheap but certainly not cheerful! On arrival at 10.30pm (after being told by the taxi driver what a dodgy area it was!) and was greeted, or shall I say ignored, by a man who could win the Rudest Man in London award. I was stood at the desk and he was watching TV and I had to get his attention. We then had a short kerfuffle about payment but it turned out this was because I hadn't understood his English. My room was in the basement and had dirt on the walls. There was a TV but no hair-dryer as I was told previously. Bathroom was tiny but clean. No hot water though which was infuriating. There was only a small lock on the door and to be frankI didn't feel very safe. Being in basement felt dodgy and I didn't sleep very well, partly because of the traffic noise too as I was at the front. Room had fridge, sink and wardobe but was VERY basic and felt more like a hostel. I didn't go to breakfast as it was only between 7.30 and 8.30am and I wanted a lie-in. Check-out was at 11am and the man at desk was friendly and was very helpful in ordering me a taxi to the station. I am sure some rooms are nice as I am not exactly used to staying at the likes of the Ritz! But if you're going, ask for a room above basement level!!

Reviews.Title: “Twice but no more”
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel is not in the best area, we choose to book it for a second time as it was ok value the first time. However, this time it was very different than the first one. The standard is obviously very different from room to room as the room we got this time was terrible. Both dirty and almost falling apart. We tried to switch room but that was not possible. Also, comming home in the middle of the night the night-receptionist become irritated because we called the bell several times to get in, as he was asleep. Only thing positive it that it is cheap but I would rather sleep in the park next time

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place !!!”
Reviews.Author: theliammurphy
Reviews.Content: The booking was made by the office staff online using the M.Ds credit card. I then discovered that payment was NOT taken from the card it was simply used to hold the room. The M.D had to go to the office on Saturday and fax a letter with his signature etc and the details of the credit card. The hotel then decided that this wasn't good enough and the M.D should call the hotel. The Hotel had a problem processing the card as the address on the credit card did not have a house number!!! The Manager of the hotel insisted that I pay for the room myself, I explained that my company was the client and that I did not have the facilities to pay for the hotel, I was told that if I did not hand over cash I would not be allowed back into my room nor would I have access to my belongings. At this point my boss went back to the office, called the credit card company and confirmed that there was obviously something wrong with the new credit card system in the hotel. The Credit Card Company and merchant verification centre offered to deal with the Hotel directly but the manager of the hotel refused to take the call. In the end my boss had to use his girlfriendsâ€™ credit card. Strangely enough neither her address details, nor expiry date were required??? I can safely say that this is the worst hotel service I and the company have ever experienced; I would advice potential guests to avoid this particular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location. And very clean.”
Reviews.Author: plebbe
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel! Especially when you are on business with a low budget then this is perfect. Clean, easy to reach, not expensive. I stayed for two nights, paid 40 pounds per night. I got a sparkling new bathroom and a clean room facing the back / South. As a result it was quiet. A big plus is the location, it is very close to Kings Cross station (not even worth taking a cab) but in a quiet street. Another plus is the room window, it can open up in full. Exceptional given that many hotels constrain the windows to prevent suicides. Arriva is confident that its guests doin't get derpessed too quickly ;-) Breakfast was okay, sufficient to get you going and sufficiently obesity-aware. Staff is friendly. There is no AC, however AC in London is not the norm, most of the time it is rather cool. Open the window and a breeze will cool you down. One thing though, please replace the flat iron. I tried to iron shirts, but a previous user dirtied the iron, so I could not really use it.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: London is a very expensive city and it is known that you get no five star hotel for a deal, so I did not expect much of the Arriva for the price we paid. But it was even worse. We spent two nights at the hotel. We were four people and had two rooms booked. Only one room was ready and the (somewhat nice) clerk at the day shift promised us that the other room will be on the same floor. When we got back in the evening the (really not nice) clerk did just not care and gave us a room on another floor. The room on the ground level was horrible... run down and no space to move. The one on the first floor was better, clean bathroom but it took half an hour to take a shower because the water pressure was zero. The door that leads to the floor would slam shut and from early morning on every minute you heard a BANG! The breakfast is typically british... toast and jam. Some cereal. The only good thing about this place was the location. Close to Kings Cross. Very convinient. But overall I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A good comfortable small hotel....good price as well. Upon my arrival, I received an amicable welcome from the employees there and a suitable room. The breakfast is excellent and rooms are equally clean. Word of caution however: if you receive one of the rooms in the level below ground level, ask to change....the traffic will wake you rather early. Otherwise....good place and good price.

Reviews.Title: “I guess you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Xstrax
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Arriva for five nights, and really didnÂ´t know what to expect. The reception clerk (evening-shift) was certainly not friendly or helpful; he just couldn't be bothered with such an exorbitant request as for an extra pillow. I decided to stay out of his face for our entire stay! The room and bathroom were tiny for anyone over five feet tall, dishevelled and tattered, with only one ceiling light; so forget about reading in bed. I wouldn't want to stay at this hotel on warm days, since turning off the radiator came up short with burning hot uncovered and uninsulated pipes leading up to it! My wife had problems with crackling and dripping sounds from pipes and refrigerator and had to take light sleeping pills; I would've slept through the blitz, so I was not bothered. We requested to change rooms from our evening shift friend (??), but were told that every room was just the same; a blatant lie, since we sneaked a peak at one of the other rooms on our floor. Everything was mostly clean though, clean sheets and towels, changed daily. Breakfast was fine, with friendly smiling staff. The location of the hotel is fine, close to King's Cross tube station and many restaurants, cafes, pubs and shops around. But why on earth would the Swintons pub be closed on saturday and sunday?? My recommendation to the hotel owners would be to hire friendlier reception staff (women maybe, like the breakfast room staff??)

Reviews.Title: “Bella esperienza”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I spent about two months at the Arriva in 2003 because of our research at the British Library. Our budget was not much, we knew we would spent most of our money in libraries and bookshops, so we chose the Arriva for 4 good reasons at least: 1. very near the Library, that is saving of time and money; 2. ensuit bathroom, for 3 (Italian) girls this was fundamental; 3. cheap, breakfast included; 4. fridge and sink in the room, so we got organized and saved much money, went to the supermarket and prepared soups, salads, sandwiches. We were not mistaken: the building and the room were not fantastic, but the staff was very kind, especially the young man on nightshift ;). The area is well served, by bus, tube or train you can go almost everywhere. In the surroundings you can find many stores, restaurants and fast food so you can buy and eat whatever you want. We missed Italian coffee very much, but if you have an electric moka or cooker you can stay wonderfully. Unfortunately, when we had to book for our next research the Arriva was fully booked, so we stayed in a different hotel, and it WAS different...

Reviews.Title: “Average King's Cross budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is about average for a budget hotel in London. Excellent location, just around the corner from King's Cross, although the small entrance is easy to miss. Reception guy was polite enough. Room was OK, a decent enough size, neither sparkling clean or absolutely filthy, bed was OK, only gripe was the rather dim lighting in the room which made it feel a bit grim. I stayed one night, arriving late and leaving early, so it was perfect for my needs. I wouldn't recommend it as a base for a longer stay, but for a cheap place to crash for the night it's ideal. The area around King's Cross is not the nicest, but there are plenty of people around and you'll be fine if you don't take unnecessary risks.

Reviews.Title: “A very satisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with my choice when visiting London recently for a conference. I only wanted a clean, comfortable and safe place to stay, so I could spend my money on books instead of hotel bills, and that is what I got! Brilliant value, excellent location, very quiet for central London! The breakfast was more than adequate and the bed very comfortable. Only complaint - no curtain on window, but I improvised and used the towels!! Would stay there again without any hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a night in this place - what a dump! Cheap but certainly not cheerful. As a group of 6 women, we booked 2 triple rooms only to be told these were not available on checking in. Bathrooms are tiny and have a lot to be desired. If you want a hot/warm shower, be sure to be up before 9am. Staff are not particularly friendly - I don't believe I saw a smile and certainly did not hear any pleasantries from them! Triple room had leak throughout the night, with water dripping down the wall. After a night out in Leicester Sq, only 1 of 16 taxis we flagged were willing to take us to Kings Cross. The area did not seem particularly safe either...my advice? Avoid this place, especially if its for more than 1 night...

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, but clean, warm and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: zx1985
